answers.answer: Did you explain the nausea and headache to your physician? Did you tell him/her that you begin to feel better while you eat but soon after you are nauseated again.What is your eating habits like? Do you drink a lot of water and take vitamin(s)? Are you under a lot of stress? Are you skipping meals?I would suggest you go back to the doctor and make your symptoms clear to him/her and see what he thinks. How long has these bouts of nausea and headaches been going on? If your not already, I would suggest taking a multivitamin, omega 3, echineacea (it has anti-inflammatory properties) drinking a peppermint tea (peppermint oils are very useful for headache sufferers) decrease your red meat intake (if you eat it) eat more fruits and veggies. This will help to kind of detox any harmful toxins from your body.. plus, I am curious to know what your bowel habits are like... you can PM me if you'd like.. I hope you begin to feel better dear!!

Hello,There are many causes of nausea in absence of pregnancy.  These include stomach disorders such as gastroenteritis, liver/gall bladder disease, cancer, medications,inner ear diseases like labrynthitis, ulcers/gastritis, metabolic like diabetes,hypothyroidism and adrenal diseases or neurological causes.Cyclic vomiting syndrome is also stated to cause constant nausea.I will sincerely advise you to consult a physician and get these possibilities ruled out one by one.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing

question: For past two weeks I have been nauseas, to the point I want to vomit, when I need to eat. When I start to eat I feel better but not too long after eating or during eating I start to become nauseous again.  Ive had headaches for the past 5 days.  I saw my husband the first week of march, as we are 8 hrs apart because of school, and I was suppose to get my period the 17th of this month but did not.  The doctor did a blood test to see if I was preg but it was negative.  what could be causing this and what do I do to feel better?
title: Nauseous
